content.description: We are measuring the number of people who have served in the UK Armed Forces and now left. This data is needed to support central and local government commitments made under the Armed Forces Covenant. This is a promise by the nation ensuring that those who serve or who have served in the armed forces, and their families, are treated fairly.

options.label: Yes, previously served in Regular Armed Forces
options.value: Yes, previously served in Regular Armed Forces

guidance.show_guidance: Why do I need to answer if I am retired or long term sick or disabled?
guidance.hide_guidance: Why do I need to answer if I am retired or long term sick or disabled

content.description: To get a true picture of the UK working population, we ask this question to everyone who is not currently working. We ask people who are retired because the number of people continuing to work after retirement age is increasing. We ask people who are long-term sick or disabled because some intend to go back to work.
